intro: Phlegmariurus pittieri, commonly known as the Pittier's haircap, is a species of moss belonging to the family Dicranaceae. It is characterized by its slender, wiry stems and small, oval-shaped leaves that are often curled when dry. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky areas. Its reproductive structures, called capsules, are borne on short, erect stalks and release spores when mature. Phlegmariurus pittieri is known for its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils and is often found in temperate regions.
